ModMetaData.name: GeneticRim
ModMetaData.author: Sarg
ModMetaData.description:
Extract DNA from animals and hybridize them to create new, exotic species!
<size=24>Features</size> - Extract genes from Bears, Chickens, Boomalopes, Muffalos, Wolves and Insectoids, and create hybrids of these species. - A bearalope is different from a boombear, so there are 25 new species to experiment with, plus 6 from insectoids and 5 from Thrumbos, for a total of 36. Some very useful, some... less so. - Once you research the advanced genetic engineering tech, you can also extract genes from Thrumbos and hybridize them! - By extracting humanoid genes, you can mix them with animal genes and create several hybrid implants to improve your colonists.
<size=24>Issues</size> Some of the biggest animals might flicker. This is to be expected, since a few of them are bigger than Thrumbos! The Boombeetle is a ranged creature, and the code for it is beta, so expect erratic behaviour.
<size=24>Notes</size> How do I progress? Here is a mini-guide: - First, research the tech. - Build a Pulper to get organic pulp from wood, and a Genetic Extraction Table to get DNA from animals and to build empty incubators. - Kill the animals to extract their genes. - Build the Gene Pod to mix the genes of different animals, and fill an empty incubator with the mixture. - The incubator will hatch in a day. Keep it warm! You will need to tame the creature afterwards, of course. - Results are random! If you mix Bear and Chicken, you might get a Bearchicken or a Chickenbear. Or the experiment can also go wrong... - Finally, research the Insectoid Genome and the Advanced genetic engineering tech, build the Advanced Gene Pod and experiment with Insectoids and Thrumbos to get the strongest creatures in the game. - On a different path, you can research humanoid genetic engineering, and develop hybrid implants to modify your colonists. Yeah, you can create a colonist that lays chicken eggs twice a day. It's hilarious and disgusting.
<size=24>Plans for the future</size> - Venomous, Armoured and Plant-like creatures - Hybrids with creatures from other animal mods - Weird special abilities for the existing creatures
<size=24>Compatibility</size> Made compatible with A Dog Said using the auto patcher: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=944381237 Should be savegame compatible and not break anything. Should!
<size=24>Changelog</size> v1.2: Added hybrid humanoid / animal implants (21/8/17) v1.1: Added the whole Insectoid hybrid family, with new tech. Added skill requirements and electricity requirements (20/8/17) v1.01: Compatibility with A Dog Said (18/8/17) v1.0: Release (17/8/17)
